data.text: @dchatenay im not disagreeing — they did some of this this way for a reason — but i dont think these people have thought even one step beyond what they’re writing
@pt completely agree. which is why I keep going back to what we were talking about the other day — gotta keep this shitstorm raging
@Carnage4Life this is the weird bind we find ourselves in right now. how to even cover it responsibly much less how the networks themselves should respond
@jonfavs it’s so funny that his rationale for replying seems to be when someone “@ mentions me and agrees with me” and these people have seemed to intuit that
@matthh yeah. i think there’s a lot of solipsism  in looking at things from years down the road without recalling context and the headspace folks were in at the time

@jaegervonkramer right, agree. the extremely generous version would be Elon thinking “well, the leftists had free rein all along so we need to spend all our time on the right”

less generous would be he’s fully right-wing and focused on that because it’s what he believes and cares about

there is an actual discussion to be had about how accounts and content are labeled and handled — it’s the stuff of all social networks and transparency only comes in fits and starts over the years (usually after prodding)

hard to have that convo when everything is a conspiracy https://t.co/oTVEKhz8gk

users.name: Joel Andren (winding down here, follow elsewhere)

tweets.text: @MikeIsaac This ignores the adversarial problems of spammers, scammers, bots, astroturfing etc. Hiding these labels makes it harder for bad actors to operate (and benefits the legit users: less junk!). Making them public is like playing poker with your hand visible to all...

@MikeIsaac If we’re forced into a binary grand conspiracy/nothingburger its the latter.

If Elon would like a more nuanced discussion, he should probably approach the entire thing differently. It seems clear what he wants is a media spectacle because that’s his best product idea. Sad!
@MikeIsaac There’s no upside for social media services to do this especially when the biggest complainers are bad actors who want to work around penalties.

Elon is now replying in agreement to Lara Logan, who was recently banned from Newsmax for spreading conspiracies about a “global cabal” of UN officials who “dine on the blood of children”:  https://t.co/6DX1xNZ2lx https://t.co/jTqLhhYzUl

urls.title: Newsmax drops Lara Logan after comments about Satan, migrants, and blood-drinking globalists
urls.description: Newsmax drops Lara Logan after comments about Satan, migrants, and blood-drinking globalists

tweets.text: @MikeIsaac Correct. Also, this isn't equivalent to viewing info that affects my personal account. These are internal controls put in place to prevent users from violating the TOS to maliciously spread content to hundreds of millions of users. in this case, USED DURING A VIOLENT UPRISING!
@MikeIsaac Also hard to have them when every demonstration of it's warts and blemishes are about Libs of TikTok and Trump, and not say CrimethInc.

You know what, I don't think the Twitter Files are a total nothingburger. You should be able to see what kinds of controls they put on your account just like Google shows you your ad targeting categories. Keeping that hidden from users is no fair.

@peterlattman @ConorDougherty @brooksbarnesNYT the big picture by Ben fritz was an illuminating read for me a few years back. basically movies are either A24 or Kevin Feige now

(Also agree with lattman—tar rocks)
@ConorDougherty @brooksbarnesNYT You can pay $20 to watch TÁR on Apple or Amazon. Worth it!

Hi, Twitter Fam just wanted to say our final good byes. It’s been a pleasure serving you this past 11 years. Twitter really made us feel apart of the culture and we will never forget that. 🎤🎤 drop https://t.co/aQZqjnEHEJ
